author: Baha'u'llah
source_text: الَّذِيْ قَدْ تَوَجَّهَ بِكُلِّهِ إِلى أُفُقِ جُودِكَ وَبَحْرِ فَضْلِكَ وَسَمآءِ أَلْطافِكَ، فَافْعَلْ بِهِ ما يَنْبَغِي لِعَظَمَتِكَ وَإِجْلالِكَ وَمَوْهِبَتِكَ وَإِفْضالِكَ،
translation: This is Thy servant, O my Lord, who with his whole being hath turned unto the horizon of Thy bounty, and the ocean of Thy grace, and the heaven of Thy gifts. Do with me then as becometh Thy majesty, and Thy glory, and Thy bounteousness, and Thy grace.
